camel.source.path.nodeAddress.name: camel.source.path.nodeAddress
camel.source.path.nodeAddress.description: Sets the node address used to communicate

camel.source.endpoint.addresses.name: camel.source.endpoint.addresses
camel.source.endpoint.addresses.description: Contract address or a list of addresses.

camel.source.endpoint.fromAddress.name: camel.source.endpoint.fromAddress
camel.source.endpoint.fromAddress.description: The address the transaction is send from

camel.source.endpoint.fromBlock.name: camel.source.endpoint.fromBlock
camel.source.endpoint.fromBlock.description: The block number, or the string latest for the last mined block or pending, earliest for not yet mined transactions.

camel.source.endpoint.fullTransactionObj.name: camel.source.endpoint.fullTransactionObjects
camel.source.endpoint.fullTransactionObj.description: If true it returns the full transaction objects, if false only the hashes of the transactions.

camel.source.endpoint.gasLimit.name: camel.source.endpoint.gasLimit
camel.source.endpoint.gasLimit.description: The maximum gas allowed in this block.

camel.source.endpoint.privateFor.name: camel.source.endpoint.privateFor
camel.source.endpoint.privateFor.description: A transaction privateFor nodes with public keys in a Quorum network

camel.source.endpoint.quorumAPI.name: camel.source.endpoint.quorumAPI
camel.source.endpoint.quorumAPI.description: If true, this will support Quorum API.

camel.source.endpoint.toAddress.name: camel.source.endpoint.toAddress
camel.source.endpoint.toAddress.description: The address the transaction is directed to.

camel.source.endpoint.toBlock.name: camel.source.endpoint.toBlock
camel.source.endpoint.toBlock.description: The block number, or the string latest for the last mined block or pending, earliest for not yet mined transactions.

camel.source.endpoint.topics.name: camel.source.endpoint.topics
camel.source.endpoint.topics.description: Topics are order-dependent. Each topic can also be a list of topics. Specify multiple topics separated by comma.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.web3j.gasLimit.name: camel.component.web3j.gasLimit
camel.component.web3j.gasLimit.description: The maximum gas allowed in this block.

camel.component.web3j.topics.name: camel.component.web3j.topics
camel.component.web3j.topics.description: Topics are order-dependent. Each topic can also be a list of topics. Specify multiple topics separated by comma.

camel.component.web3j.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.
